messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] did you know??
messages.msgSnippet: What is your source on this? I know that penicillin is given as a prophylactic to help prevent anemia in children with sickle cell anemia. My PDR doesn t
messages.messageBody:
What is your source on this? I know that penicillin is
given as a
prophylactic to help prevent anemia in children with
sickle cell anemia. My
PDR doesn't list anything about anemia and I don't find
anything on the net
about anything but the usual upset stomach, diahrrea,
vomitting and skin
rash. Oh and of course those who are allergic and
anaphalactic shock.

Lynda

I was searching for info on ABO incompatability and the
Coombes(sp?) test on www.findarticles.com One of the
entries I found mentioned penicillin as a possible
cause.

Tracy

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] did you know??
messages.msgSnippet: What is your source on this?  I know that penicillin is given as a prophylactic to help prevent anemia in children with sickle cell anemia.  My PDR doesn t
messages.messageBody:
What is your source on this? I know that penicillin is given as a
prophylactic to help prevent anemia in children with sickle cell anemia. My
PDR doesn't list anything about anemia and I don't find anything on the net
about anything but the usual upset stomach, diahrrea, vomitting and skin
rash. Oh and of course those who are allergic and anaphalactic shock.

Lynda
----- Original Message -----
From: Tracy Oldfield <tracy.oldfield@...>
To: <uk-home-ed-fluff@yahoogroups.com>;
<unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>;
<imperfectly_Natural_Parents_UK@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, August 29, 2001 1:42 AM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] did you know??


> I've just discovered that penicillin can cause anaemia!! Anyone
> else know that?
>
> Tracy/Trog
